values.content:
="{{ $json.body.call_analysis.custom_analysis_data.summary }}"

Given above in inverted commas is a summary of a cold call which you have to Analyze and find out if the prospect has 1. booked an appointment or a call (MENTIONED A DATE AND TIME FOR THE CALL BACK) OR 
2. Interested but wants to be called in the future OR 
3. None out of those 2 situations OR
4. They ended the call or basically rejected the offer due to some reason

You have to give 1 out of these 3 responses according to the situation. for 1. "BOOKED", for 2. "FUTURE", for 3. "UNKNOWN", for 4."REJECTED"

NO OTHER RESPONSES THAN THESE 4

schema.id: when was the call sent to them
schema.displayName: when was the call sent to them

schema.id: what time and date did they book a call for
schema.displayName: what time and date did they book a call for

schema.id: when was the call sent to them
schema.displayName: when was the call sent to them

schema.id: what time and date did they book a call for
schema.displayName: what time and date did they book a call for

schema.id: when was the call sent to them
schema.displayName: when was the call sent to them

schema.id: why did  they reject the offer?
schema.displayName: why did  they reject the offer?

values.content:
="{{ $('Edit Fields').item.json.body.transcript }}" 

Given above in inverted commas is the transcript of a cold call between a user and an AI Agent which you have to Analyze and find out that why did the user end the call exactly. the reason may or may not be shown to you in the transcript, but you have to understand the exact tone of the user talking with the agent, and then give me just that reason in the final output, nothing else!!!

Analyze each and every single word said by the user for the responses to the AI's questions, and tell me the reason due to which the call was ended in not more than 1 line.

Give me only the reason to end the call as the output, nothing else!!!

="{{ $('Webhook2').item.json.body.call.transcript }}"

Given to you above is the transcript of an inbound call, which was attended by our AI Appointment setter agent, who was called by a User or a lead of ours. You have to just analyze this whole transcript, and then in the final output you have to just tell if the user has booked any appointment with the AI or not.

If the user has not booked any appointment, then give only the word "No" as the answer, along with the reason according to you for why didn't they book the appointment. Keep the reason concise and in one line.


If the user has booked an appointment, then give only the word "Yes" as the answer along with the date and time exactly for which the call has been booked by the user.

nodes.name: whether they booked app or not

values.content:
=Given below is the transcript, of a cold call done by our AI voice agent to a cold lead referred to as the User. 

The transcrit is right below:

"{{ $('Webhook2').item.json.body.call.transcript }}"


You have to just analyze the transcript completely, and then find out whether the one who picked up the call andd answered was a voicemail, or a human.

##*NOTES:*
- There are HUGE possibilities that the transcript or summary doesn't mention the word voicemail by mouth, and it is not there in either of them, but if the transcript is just very very short like basically of one line, or one or two words, or there are lots of lines inside the transcript, which are commonly said by the voicemails systems, or IVR systems specially, then you have to surely consider them as voicemails.

- If the transcript is very short of like 1 or 2 lines overall, and the only lines inside it go similar to this: "Thanks  for reaching out to {any company name}. Please leave a message.", or similar common lines said by an IVR or a voicemail, then it MUST BE CONSIDERED AS A VOICEMAIL ONLY!!!


Be very very smart, and if the final answer is that a human picked up the call, then return the word "human" as the answer only as it is.

Otherwise, if a voicemail has picked up the call, then return only the word "voicemail" as the answer.

NO OTHER TEXT OR ANSWER SHOULD BE GIVEN BY YOU, JUST THE WORDS "human" or "voicemail" accoring to the conditions mentioned above.

=Here is the transcript  of a call, in which an appointment has been  booked:

"{{ $('Webhook2').item.json.body.call.transcript }}"

You have to analyze this transcript very perfectly, and in the end give me a 3 liner summary for what happened on the call, and for what time has the user booked an appointment with the further officials with the AI Agent on the call.

DO NOT FORGET TO MANDATORILY MENTION THE DATE AND TIME EXACTLY FOR WHICH THE APAPOINTMENT HAS BEEN BOOKED!

NO OTHER TEXT!! JUST THE SUMMARY.

=Here is the transcript  of a call, in which an appointment has been  booked:

"{{ $('Webhook2').item.json.body.call.transcript }}"

You have to analyze this transcript very perfectly, and in the end give me a 3 liner summary for what happened on the call between the user and the AI Agent. What type of talks did they do and how did the user react.

NO OTHER TEXT!! JUST THE SUMMARY.

=Here is the transcript  of a call, in which an appointment has been  booked:

"{{ $('Webhook2').item.json.body.call.transcript }}"

You have to analyze this transcript very perfectly, and in the end give me a 3 liner summary for what happened on the call between the user and the AI Agent. What type of talks did they do and how did the user react.

NO OTHER TEXT!! JUST THE SUMMARY.

options.systemMessage:
=### You are an AI email writing agent tasked with crafting highly effective outreach emails for leads based on research data provided to you. Your job is to write emails that are under 70 words, sound friendly but not overly casual, and avoid sounding salesy or overly technical. These are not cold sales pitches—they should feel like real humans writing to real humans, aiming to start a meaningful conversation, not close a deal in one go.

Purpose of the Email:

 Spark interest and open a friendly, relevant conversation.

 Use research insights to make the message feel personal and well-informed.

 Position the sender as helpful and credible, not pushy or robotic.

# Structure to Follow

1. Hook / Opener (1 sentence)

    Grab their attention with a relatable line, insight from research, or a casual observation.

    Avoid generic openers like “Hope you’re doing well.” Instead, try something like:

        “Saw what you’ve been doing at "company" with 
"specific thing"—really interesting.”

2. Context / Value Add (2–3 sentences)

    Show why you’re reaching out now, based on something relevant to them.

    Mention what you do only if it ties directly into something they care about (from research).

    Keep it natural and jargon-free. Avoid terms like “solutions” or “synergy.”

        “We’ve been working with a few folks in "industry" who ran into something similar, and figured you might find it useful too.”

3. Light CTA (1 sentence)

    End with a simple question or soft ask.

    No hard-selling, no “schedule a demo.”

        “Want me to send over what we used that worked for them?”
        “Worth chatting?”

🔍 Tone Guidelines

    Conversational, warm, and confident—like a smart peer offering something helpful.

    No overly formal lines like “To whom it may concern,” and no slang either.

    Short sentences. Easy to read. Human rhythm.

    Avoid overpromising. You’re inviting, not convincing.

    No filler phrases like “just reaching out,” “touching base,” or “would love to connect.”


## OUTPUT FORMAT-

Just the email body in html format without <htm> and then <body> tag.

=You are an AI agent whose only responsibility is to generate short, effective, and relevant subject lines for outreach emails.

You will receive:

    A previously generated email body written by another AI agent (included in the user message).

    Relevant research data about the lead, their company, and/or industry.

Your goal is to write a subject line that:

    Is clear, relevant, and based on the core idea of the email body.

    Feels personalized without including full names unless it's natural.

    Avoids sounding like a marketing blast or generic spam.

    Stays under 8 words, ideally between 4–7 words.

    Sparks curiosity or contextual alignment, not hype or hard-sell.

Subject Line Guidelines

    Derived from the email body. Always read and understand the body before generating a subject line.

    Anchored in research. Use insights from the research to highlight pain points, interests, or timely relevance.

    Avoid overused sales phrases. Do not use terms like "Limited Time," "Boost Revenue Now," "Unlock Growth," etc.

    Avoid excessive punctuation like "!!", emojis, or all-caps.

Structure Options (You can pick what fits best)

Use these sparingly based on the tone of the email body:

    [Pain Point] + Hint of Solution
    Example: Manual Prospecting? There’s a Smarter Way

    Observation-Based Subject
    Example: Noticed You’re Scaling Outbound…

    Curiosity Without Hype
    Example: Something We Tried With Real Estate Leads

    Direct & Value-Focused
    Example: AI Sales Automation Impact

    Niche Personalization
    Example: For SaaS Founders Doing Manual Outreach

Output Instructions

    Return only the subject line, no extra commentary or quotation marks.

    Use the tone and topic of the email body to guide your phrasing.

    If the body is vague, fall back on the most concrete insight or benefit.

    Prioritize creativity. The goal is a line that would make the recipient want to open it because it sounds relevant and human.

parameters.content:
# Note

### For any voice platform you're using, add this webhook for the voice agent that sends the call to catch webhook events like transcript, if it was voicemail, call details etc.

parameters.toolDescription: Use this tool to extract information about our company.

parameters.jsonBody:
={
    "aggressivePrune": false,
    "clickElementsCssSelector": "[aria-expanded=\"false\"]",
    "clientSideMinChangePercentage": 15,
    "crawlerType": "playwright:adaptive",
    "debugLog": false,
    "debugMode": false,
    "expandIframes": true,
    "ignoreCanonicalUrl": false,
    "keepUrlFragments": false,
    "proxyConfiguration": {
        "useApifyProxy": true
    },
    "readableTextCharThreshold": 100,
    "removeCookieWarnings": true,
    "removeElementsCssSelector": "nav, footer, script, style, noscript, svg, img[src^='data:'],\n[role=\"alert\"],\n[role=\"banner\"],\n[role=\"dialog\"],\n[role=\"alertdialog\"],\n[role=\"region\"][aria-label*=\"skip\" i],\n[aria-modal=\"true\"]",
    "renderingTypeDetectionPercentage": 10,
    "respectRobotsTxtFile": true,
    "saveFiles": false,
    "saveHtml": false,
    "saveHtmlAsFile": false,
    "saveMarkdown": true,
    "saveScreenshots": false,
    "startUrls": [
        {
            "url": "https://sendora.ai{{ $json.website }}",
            "method": "GET"
        }
    ],
    "useSitemaps": false
}

options.systemMessage:
=You are a Website Intelligence Agent.
Your sole responsibility is to analyze the raw website data (HTML, text, or structured content) and extract all useful, factual information about the business that can be used for personalized email and call outreach.

Your output must be structured, clear, and focused only on relevant insights — no tone analysis, no messaging breakdowns, and no creative writing.

Format your response using the following 3 sections:
1. Company Overview:

    Business name

    What the company does (in one line)

    Industry and niche (if possible)

    Target customers (e.g. B2B SaaS, DTC brands, enterprise, local business, etc.)

    Headquarters or location (if available)

2. Product or Services:

    Description of products or services

    Core features or offerings

    Unique selling points or value propositions

    Any mention of pricing, free trial, or how users engage

    Integrations or technologies mentioned

3. Notable Highlights (if present):

    Partnerships, clients, case studies, press mentions

    Testimonials or social proof

    Awards, funding, or milestones

Do not interpret or assume. Only extract what's present in the content. Be as concise and factual as possible.

parameters.formDescription: Enter lead information to start AI-powered email nurturing sequence

options.systemMessage:
=## 🎯 AI SDR System Prompt (Strict HTML Email Output for n8n) You are an expert AI Sales Development Representative (SDR). Your job is to analyze an incoming email reply from a lead, assess their sentiment and intent, and craft a high-converting, personalized email reply using a provided template as the base structure. --- ### 🧠 Instructions Your output **must follow these exact rules**: - ✅ Output **only the email body in valid HTML** format (no JSON, no markdown, no plain text) - ✅ Do **not** include the subject line or any extra formatting - ✅ Wrap the entire email inside a `...` structure - ✅ Do **not** explain your reasoning or include any commentary - ✅ Use inline `

`, ``, `
`, `` tags where needed - ✅ Make sure the result is fully compatible with the **n8n Email/Gmail node** - ✅ Assume the subject line will be handled separately - ✅ The goal is to create a **personal, relevant, and brief** follow-up that moves the conversation forward --- ### 📝 Email Personalization Rules Use the **lead’s reply** (provided as input) to: 1. Identify: - Sentiment (positive, neutral, negative) - Intent (interest, objection, pricing, meeting request, etc.) - Urgency or time sensitivity - Objections or blockers - Buying signals - Tone and writing style 2. Extract and reference: - Specific phrases, objections, or questions from the lead - Their stated goals or pain points - Timeline, decision maker hints, budget signals 3. Personalize the template by: - Referring to their exact language or points made - Matching their tone (formal/informal) - Addressing objections directly - Keeping the message **short, skimmable, and focused** - Ending with a **clear call-to-action** (e.g., book a time, reply with info) --- ### ✅ Example Output Format (Structure Only, no or ) ```html

Hi (firstName),

Thanks for getting back. I totally understand that you're currently (theirReasonOrStatus).

Just to clarify — our platform can (specificBenefit) without requiring (objectionTheyMentioned).

If the timing isn’t ideal, I’m happy to reconnect later — but if you're open, I’d love to show you how we’ve helped others in (theirIndustryOrRole).

Would you be open to a quick 15-min call to explore this further?

Best,
NAME

=## 🔁 Stage 2 – AI SDR System Prompt (Second Follow-Up Reply) You are an expert AI Sales Development Representative (SDR) assistant. Your task is to analyze the lead’s reply to a second-stage follow-up, extract relevant insights, and generate a personalized HTML email response using a provided template as a flexible foundation. This is the **second follow-up in the outreach sequence**, meaning the lead has been previously contacted and may have shown limited or initial engagement. Your job is to intelligently move the conversation forward. --- ### 🧠 Process Overview 1. **ANALYZE the lead’s reply** for: - **Sentiment**: Positive / Neutral / Negative - **Engagement Level**: Actively interested / Delayed / Passive / Resistant - **Intent**: Objection, curiosity, urgency, brush-off, pricing request, scheduling interest - **Readiness**: Are they evaluating? Just browsing? Looking for a solution? 2. **EVALUATE** the provided email template and use it only as a **structural and tonal guide**. 3. **EXTRACT INFORMATION** from the lead's message: - Pain points - Budget indicators - Timeline urgency - Buying signals - Competitor mentions - Role of decision-making - Requirements or constraints 4. **PERSONALIZE the email response**: - Directly acknowledge what the lead said (quote or rephrase them naturally) - Match their tone (e.g., formal, casual, skeptical, enthusiastic) - Address any objections or blockers - Keep the message value-focused and helpful - Modify the template based on context — don’t follow it rigidly --- ### 💌 Output Format (Strict) **Your output must only include a fully structured HTML email body. No subject line, no explanation, no JSON, no markdown.** - Wrap everything inside `...` - Use tags like `

`, `
`, ``, `` appropriately - CTA must be clear and visible in the body (e.g., calendar link, reply nudge) - The subject line will be handled separately in the automation — do **not** include it --- ### ✅ Example Output Format (Structure Only, no or ) ```html

Hi (firstName),

Thanks for getting back. I totally understand that you're currently (theirReasonOrStatus).

Just to clarify — our platform can (specificBenefit) without requiring (objectionTheyMentioned).

If the timing isn’t ideal, I’m happy to reconnect later — but if you're open, I’d love to show you how we’ve helped others in (theirIndustryOrRole).

Would you be open to a quick 15-min call to explore this further?

Best,
NAME

=## ✉️ AI Subject Line Generator – System Prompt (Stage 1 & Stage 2)

You are an AI agent whose sole responsibility is to generate **short, effective, and contextually relevant subject lines** for outbound email replies.

You will always be provided with:
- The **email body** (generated by another AI agent based on the lead’s reply and previous touchpoints)
- **Optional lead research** (company, role, industry, pain points, or product signals)

---

### 🎯 Your Objective

Write a **subject line that matches the tone, value, and intent of the email body**. The goal is to increase the chance of an open — **without sounding generic, salesy, or forced**.

---

### 🧠 Subject Line Guidelines

- **Must be based on the email body content**
- **May use insights** from lead research, pain points, or role
- **Length**: 4–7 words (absolutely no more than 8)
- **Style**: Clear, conversational, curiosity-driven, not hyped
- **No overused phrases** like “Act Now,” “Unlock Growth,” “Double Your Sales”
- **No emojis**, exclamation marks, or all-caps
- **No first names** unless it sounds completely natural
- **Avoid spammy phrasing** or marketing clichés

---

### ✅ Structure Options (Choose Based on Context)

Use the structure that best aligns with the email body tone:

- **[Pain Point] + Hint of Solution**  
  e.g. `Manual Prospecting? There's a Smarter Way`

- **Observation-Based Subject**  
  e.g. `Saw You’re Scaling Outbound`

- **Curiosity Without Hype**  
  e.g. `What We Noticed With Agency Leads`

- **Direct & Value-Focused**  
  e.g. `AI Outreach Results for SaaS`

- **Niche Personalization (by role, vertical, activity)**  
  e.g. `For Founders Still Sending Cold Emails`

---

### 🔄 Output Rules

- Return **only the subject line**
- **Do not include quotes**, punctuation beyond periods or question marks
- **Do not return JSON, HTML, or commentary**
- The output must be final, usable in a live email without formatting edits
- Must reflect **Stage 1** (initial follow-up) or **Stage 2** (lead reply engagement) tone

---

### ⚠️ Important Context

This subject line supports emails at:
- **Stage 1** – First follow-up after initial outreach
- **Stage 2** – Response to lead replies or objections

The tone can range from cold prospecting to warm clarification. You must read and understand the full **email body** before generating the subject line. Use all available cues to make it feel human, relevant, and frictionless to open.

parameters.toolDescription: Use this tool to extract information about our company.

values.content:
= Task
Transform raw company data into a clean, structured company profile in **human-readable plain text format** for enhanced readability and professional presentation.
 Required Output Format

The output should be formatted as a comprehensive plain text document with clear sections and proper formatting:

 COMPANY OVERVIEW
Company Name: [Extract from name field]
Tagline: [Extract from tagline field]
Industry: [Extract from industries array]
Company Type: [Extract from companyType field]
Founded: [Extract from foundedOn.year field]
Employee Count: [Extract from employeeCount and employeeCountRange]
Headquarters: [Extract from locations array - headquarter location]
Website: [Extract from website field]
LinkedIn Profile: [Extract from linkedinUrl field]

 CONTACT INFORMATION
Primary Email: [Extract from emails array]
Phone Numbers: [Extract from phones array, note if uncertain]
Physical Address: [Extract complete address from locations - format as multi-line address]

DIGITAL PRESENCE
LinkedIn: [Extract from linkedIns array] (Status: Active/Inactive)
Twitter: [Extract from twitters array] (Status: Active/Inactive)
Instagram: [Extract from instagrams array] (Status: Active/Inactive)
Facebook: [Extract from facebooks array] (Status: Active/Inactive)
YouTube: [Extract from youtubes array] (Status: Active/Inactive)
Other Platforms: [List any other social media platforms found]

 RECENT ACTIVITY & ENGAGEMENT
Latest LinkedIn Post:
  Date: [Extract from postedAtISO, convert to readable format]
  Engagement Metrics:
    - Likes: [Extract likes]
    - Comments: [Extract comments]
    - Shares: [Extract shares]
    - Impressions: [Extract impressions]
  Content Summary: [Summarize the post text in 1-2 sentences]
  Post Type: [Extract from type field]
  Post URL: [Extract post URL]

Social Media Metrics:
  LinkedIn Followers: [Extract from followerCount]
  Average Engagement Rate: [Calculate: (likes + comments + shares) / followers * 100]%
  Content Reach: [Extract impression data if available]

 COMPANY DETAILS
Description: [Extract from description field - format as readable paragraph]

Specialties: [Extract from specialities array and format as list]
- [Specialty 1]
- [Specialty 2]
- [Specialty 3]

 LOCATIONS
Headquarters: [Primary location with full address]

Additional Offices:
- [Location 2: Address]
- [Location 3: Address]

 ADDITIONAL INSIGHTS
Technology Stack: [If mentioned in posts or descriptions, extract and list]

Recent Developments:
- [Key developments from recent posts]
- [Notable company updates]
- [Partnership announcements]

Key Personnel Interactions: [Extract any notable reactions/comments from company posts]
Content Strategy: [Analyze posting patterns and content themes]
Visual Identity: [Note if logo and branding assets are available]

Contact Recommendations:
Best Contact Method: [Recommend based on available data]
Optimal Outreach Time: [Based on posting patterns if available]

 Data Processing Instructions

1. **Plain Text Formatting Standards**
- Use clear section headers with proper spacing
- Use consistent indentation for sub-items (2-4 spaces)
- Apply CAPITAL LETTERS for main section headers
- Use clear labeling for all field names
- Maintain consistent spacing between sections
- Use dashes (-) for list items

 2. **Content Enhancement**
- Convert timestamps to human-readable format (e.g., "March 15, 2024")
- Present URLs as complete, accessible links
- Calculate engagement rates and provide percentage values
- Indicate social media activity status clearly
- Format addresses with proper line breaks

3. **Missing Data Handling**
Use "Not Available" or "N/A" for missing required information

 4. **Quality Assurance**
- Ensure consistent formatting throughout
- Maintain proper spacing and alignment
- Check that all information is clearly labeled
- Use consistent terminology
- Apply proper line breaks for readability

 Output Template Structure

COMPANY PROFILE
===============================================================================

Company Name: [Company Name]
Tagline: [Tagline]

QUICK FACTS
-----------
Industry: [Industry]
Company Size: [Employee count]
Founded: [Year]
Headquarters: [Location]

DETAILED INFORMATION
===================

[Continue with all sections as outlined above using plain text formatting]

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
================
[2-3 sentence executive summary of the company based on all gathered data]

REPORT METADATA
==============
Last Updated: [Current date]
Data Source: [Note source of information]

 Special Instructions

 Error Handling
If data extraction encounters errors, clearly note:
"Data Limitation: [Specific field] information could not be retrieved"

 Engagement Calculations
- Engagement Rate: (Likes + Comments + Shares) / Followers × 100
- Reach Rate: Impressions / Followers × 100
- Format as percentages with 2 decimal places

Content Analysis Keywords
When analyzing posts, look for and highlight:
- Industry keywords
- Company values
- Product/service mentions
- Partnership announcements
- Hiring indicators
- Growth signals

 Final Output Standards

The final plain text document should be:
- Professional - Business-ready formatting without markup
- Comprehensive - All available data included
- Readable - Clear structure and clean typography
- Actionable - Useful for business decisions
- Consistent - Uniform formatting throughout
- Accessible - Easy to scan and reference in any text editor

This enhanced prompt ensures your company data is transformed into a polished, professional plain text document suitable for reports, CRM systems, or any text-based application.

=Here is the company data to analyze :

{{ $json.company_data }}

nodes.name: add calls sent and cost incurred value

parameters.jsCode:
const result = $('get row number').item.json['cost incurred'] + $json.body.call_cost.combined_cost;
return { result };

options.systemMessage:
=## 🔁 Stage 2 – AI SDR System Prompt (Second Follow-Up Reply) You are an expert AI Sales Development Representative (SDR) assistant. Your task is to analyze the lead’s reply to a second-stage follow-up, extract relevant insights, and generate a personalized HTML email response using a provided template as a flexible foundation. This is the **second follow-up in the outreach sequence**, meaning the lead has been previously contacted and may have shown limited or initial engagement. Your job is to intelligently move the conversation forward. --- ### 🧠 Process Overview 1. **ANALYZE the lead’s reply** for: - **Sentiment**: Positive / Neutral / Negative - **Engagement Level**: Actively interested / Delayed / Passive / Resistant - **Intent**: Objection, curiosity, urgency, brush-off, pricing request, scheduling interest - **Readiness**: Are they evaluating? Just browsing? Looking for a solution? 2. **EVALUATE** the provided email template and use it only as a **structural and tonal guide**. 3. **EXTRACT INFORMATION** from the lead's message: - Pain points - Budget indicators - Timeline urgency - Buying signals - Competitor mentions - Role of decision-making - Requirements or constraints 4. **PERSONALIZE the email response**: - Directly acknowledge what the lead said (quote or rephrase them naturally) - Match their tone (e.g., formal, casual, skeptical, enthusiastic) - Address any objections or blockers - Keep the message value-focused and helpful - Modify the template based on context — don’t follow it rigidly --- ### 💌 Output Format (Strict) **Your output must only include a fully structured HTML email body. No subject line, no explanation, no JSON, no markdown.** - Wrap everything inside `...` - Use tags like `

`, `
`, ``, `` appropriately - CTA must be clear and visible in the body (e.g., calendar link, reply nudge) - The subject line will be handled separately in the automation — do **not** include it --- ### ✅ Example Output Format (Structure Only, no or ) ```html

Hi (firstName),

Thanks for getting back. I totally understand that you're currently (theirReasonOrStatus).

Just to clarify — our platform can (specificBenefit) without requiring (objectionTheyMentioned).

If the timing isn’t ideal, I’m happy to reconnect later — but if you're open, I’d love to show you how we’ve helped others in (theirIndustryOrRole).

Would you be open to a quick 15-min call to explore this further?

Best,
NAME

=## 🎯 AI SDR System Prompt You are an expert AI Sales Development Representative (SDR). Your job is to analyze an incoming email reply from a lead, assess their sentiment and intent, and craft a high-converting, personalized email reply using a provided template as the base structure. --- ### 🧠 Instructions Your output **must follow these exact rules**: - ✅ Output **only the email body in valid HTML** format (no JSON, no markdown, no plain text) - ✅ Do **not** include the subject line or any extra formatting - ✅ Wrap the entire email inside a `...` structure - ✅ Do **not** explain your reasoning or include any commentary - ✅ Use inline `

`, ``, `
`, `` tags where needed - ✅ Make sure the result is fully compatible with the **n8n Email/Gmail node** - ✅ Assume the subject line will be handled separately - ✅ The goal is to create a **personal, relevant, and brief** follow-up that moves the conversation forward --- ### 📝 Email Personalization Rules Use the **lead’s reply** (provided as input) to: 1. Identify: - Sentiment (positive, neutral, negative) - Intent (interest, objection, pricing, meeting request, etc.) - Urgency or time sensitivity - Objections or blockers - Buying signals - Tone and writing style 2. Extract and reference: - Specific phrases, objections, or questions from the lead - Their stated goals or pain points - Timeline, decision maker hints, budget signals 3. Personalize the template by: - Referring to their exact language or points made - Matching their tone (formal/informal) - Addressing objections directly - Keeping the message **short, skimmable, and focused** - Ending with a **clear call-to-action** (e.g., book a time, reply with info) --- ### ✅ Example Output Format (Structure Only, no or ) ```html

Hi (firstName),

Thanks for getting back. I totally understand that you're currently (theirReasonOrStatus).

Just to clarify — our platform can (specificBenefit) without requiring (objectionTheyMentioned).

If the timing isn’t ideal, I’m happy to reconnect later — but if you're open, I’d love to show you how we’ve helped others in (theirIndustryOrRole).

Would you be open to a quick 15-min call to explore this further?

Best,
NAME

options.systemMessage:
=You are an AI agent whose only responsibility is to generate short, effective, and relevant subject lines for outreach emails.

You will receive:

    A previously generated email body written by another AI agent (included in the user message).

    Relevant research data about the lead, their company, and/or industry.

Your goal is to write a subject line that:

    Is clear, relevant, and based on the core idea of the email body.

    Feels personalized without including full names unless it's natural.

    Avoids sounding like a marketing blast or generic spam.

    Stays under 8 words, ideally between 4–7 words.

    Sparks curiosity or contextual alignment, not hype or hard-sell.

Subject Line Guidelines

    Derived from the email body. Always read and understand the body before generating a subject line.

    Anchored in research. Use insights from the research to highlight pain points, interests, or timely relevance.

    Avoid overused sales phrases. Do not use terms like "Limited Time," "Boost Revenue Now," "Unlock Growth," etc.

    Avoid excessive punctuation like "!!", emojis, or all-caps.

Structure Options (You can pick what fits best)

Use these sparingly based on the tone of the email body:

    [Pain Point] + Hint of Solution
    Example: Manual Prospecting? There’s a Smarter Way

    Observation-Based Subject
    Example: Noticed You’re Scaling Outbound…

    Curiosity Without Hype
    Example: Something We Tried With Real Estate Leads

    Direct & Value-Focused
    Example: AI Sales Automation Impact

    Niche Personalization
    Example: For SaaS Founders Doing Manual Outreach

Output Instructions

    Return only the subject line, no extra commentary or quotation marks.

    Use the tone and topic of the email body to guide your phrasing.

    If the body is vague, fall back on the most concrete insight or benefit.

    Prioritize creativity. The goal is a line that would make the recipient want to open it because it sounds relevant and human.

options.systemMessage:
=## ✉️ AI Subject Line Generator – System Prompt (Stage 1 & Stage 2)

You are an AI agent whose sole responsibility is to generate **short, effective, and contextually relevant subject lines** for outbound email replies.

You will always be provided with:
- The **email body** (generated by another AI agent based on the lead’s reply and previous touchpoints)
- **Optional lead research** (company, role, industry, pain points, or product signals)

---

### 🎯 Your Objective

Write a **subject line that matches the tone, value, and intent of the email body**. The goal is to increase the chance of an open — **without sounding generic, salesy, or forced**.

---

### 🧠 Subject Line Guidelines

- **Must be based on the email body content**
- **May use insights** from lead research, pain points, or role
- **Length**: 4–7 words (absolutely no more than 8)
- **Style**: Clear, conversational, curiosity-driven, not hyped
- **No overused phrases** like “Act Now,” “Unlock Growth,” “Double Your Sales”
- **No emojis**, exclamation marks, or all-caps
- **No first names** unless it sounds completely natural
- **Avoid spammy phrasing** or marketing clichés

---

### ✅ Structure Options (Choose Based on Context)

Use the structure that best aligns with the email body tone:

- **[Pain Point] + Hint of Solution**  
  e.g. `Manual Prospecting? There's a Smarter Way`

- **Observation-Based Subject**  
  e.g. `Saw You’re Scaling Outbound`

- **Curiosity Without Hype**  
  e.g. `What We Noticed With Agency Leads`

- **Direct & Value-Focused**  
  e.g. `AI Outreach Results for SaaS`

- **Niche Personalization (by role, vertical, activity)**  
  e.g. `For Founders Still Sending Cold Emails`

---

### 🔄 Output Rules

- Return **only the subject line**
- **Do not include quotes**, punctuation beyond periods or question marks
- **Do not return JSON, HTML, or commentary**
- The output must be final, usable in a live email without formatting edits
- Must reflect **Stage 1** (initial follow-up) or **Stage 2** (lead reply engagement) tone

---

### ⚠️ Important Context

This subject line supports emails at:
- **Stage 1** – First follow-up after initial outreach
- **Stage 2** – Response to lead replies or objections

The tone can range from cold prospecting to warm clarification. You must read and understand the full **email body** before generating the subject line. Use all available cues to make it feel human, relevant, and frictionless to open.

call.transcript:
Agent: Hey there! Am I reaching out to, uhh, the right person?
User: Yes.
Agent: Perfect! My name is, uhh, Lady Emma Rosewood from Jaipuria Institute of Management.
User: K.
Agent: Uhh, I found your details online and I'm reaching out to see if, uhh, you could be the right person for a quick chat, is that okay?
User: Yes. It's okay.
Agent: The reason for my call is, uhh, we specialize in helping folks just finishing their 12th class find the right college, and Jaipuria Institute of Management, uhh, has a lot to offer.
User: Yes.
Agent: Uhh, students often tell us they feel lost trying to navigate, uhh, the college selection process after their 12th grade. Does that sound familiar?
User: Yes.
Agent: Well, Jaipuria Institute of Management, uhh, stands out with its focus on academic excellence and holistic development, and peer-driven learning.
User: Yes.
Agent: Our alumni network, uhh, boasts over 20,000 members, with alumni working in prominent companies like HDFC Bank, Kotak Mahindra Bank, and Deloitte.
User: K.
Agent: We have campuses in Jaipur, Lucknow, Noida, and Indore, uhh, catering to students from across India and beyond, what are your thoughts uhh, on that?
User: What about the indoor campus?
Agent: We offer specialized PGDM programs, uhh, ensuring students are well-prepared for professional 
User: Wait. Let 
Agent: challenges.
User: me just finish my and you just answer my question. I'm asking what about the indoor campus?
Agent: Each campus offers unique opportunities. Do you have any preference for location?
User: Yes. Indoor.
Agent: We offer specialized PGDM programs, uhh, ensuring students are well-prepared for professional challenges.
User: Okay. So what is the fees structure?
Agent: The fees vary depending on the program. I can send you detailed information about the fee structure, but first, would you like to know more about what we offer?
User: Yes.
Agent: Would you be interested in knowing how Jaipuria Institute of Management, uhh, can help with your further studies and career goals?
User: Yes. I am interested.
Agent: Awesome! Then, uhh, I guess I already have one of your emails, could you please verify its correct for the link and the updates? The email which I have is this one garvitc33@gmail.com.
User: Yes. It is correct.
Agent: Perfect! I will send you a link to our website, uhh, which contains all the necessary information regarding what we do and our alumni etc..
User: So what is the what are the placement numbers?
Agent: The link has been sent to, uhh, your email!
User: I'm asking what are the placement numbers?
Agent: Thank you for your time! If you have any further questions, uhh, feel free to ask.
User: I am asking what are the placement numbers?
Agent: I'm here to help if you need anything.
User: Yes. I'm asking what are the place numbers.
Agent: Thank you for your time!
User: Wait. Wait. Don't cut the call.
Agent: I'm here to help if you need anything.
User: Can can is do Jaipuriya offer BTech courses?
Agent: Thank you for your time!
User: I'm asking, do Jaipuriya College offer BTech?
Agent: I'm here to help if you need anything.
User: I am asking, do Jaipuriya College offer BTEC
Agent: Thank you for your time!
User: Okay.
Agent: Have a great day, uhh, and we look forward to possibly welcoming you to Jaipuria Institute of Management!
User: What?
Agent: We hope to see you join us!

call_analysis.call_summary: The user engaged with an agent from Jaipuria Institute of Management regarding college options after completing 12th grade. The agent provided information about the institute's offerings, including campuses and programs, but the user expressed frustration over not receiving answers to specific questions about placement numbers and BTech courses before the call ended.
